events.title: API Weekly Crude Stock
events.description: American Petroleum Institute weekly crude oil inventory estimate. Released Tuesday evening as a preview of official EIA data.
events.whyItMatters: Early indicator of official EIA data. Large deviations from expectations can move oil prices in after-hours trading.

events.title: Empire State Manufacturing Index
events.description: Monthly survey of NY manufacturers on business conditions. Above 0 = expansion.
events.whyItMatters: First regional manufacturing survey of the month. Early read on manufacturing trends.

events.title: Crude Oil Inventories
events.description: Weekly change in the number of barrels of crude oil held in inventory by commercial firms.
events.whyItMatters: Inventory builds suggest weak demand or oversupply, pushing oil prices lower. Draws indicate strong demand, pushing prices higher.

events.title: Philly Fed Manufacturing Index
events.description: Monthly survey of Philadelphia-area manufacturers. Above 0 = expansion.
events.whyItMatters: Key regional indicator. Often previews national manufacturing trends.

events.title: Natural Gas Storage
events.description: Weekly change in the number of cubic feet of natural gas held in underground storage.
events.whyItMatters: Storage levels relative to seasonal norms affect natural gas prices significantly.

events.title: API Weekly Crude Stock
events.description: American Petroleum Institute weekly crude oil inventory estimate. Released Tuesday evening as a preview of official EIA data.
events.whyItMatters: Early indicator of official EIA data. Large deviations from expectations can move oil prices in after-hours trading.

events.title: Crude Oil Inventories
events.description: Weekly change in the number of barrels of crude oil held in inventory by commercial firms.
events.whyItMatters: Inventory builds suggest weak demand or oversupply, pushing oil prices lower. Draws indicate strong demand, pushing prices higher.

events.title: Fed Beige Book
events.description: Summary of economic conditions across the 12 Federal Reserve districts based on anecdotal reports.

typicalReaction.hawkish: USD mildly bullish
typicalReaction.dovish: USD mildly bearish

events.frequency: 8 times per year (2 weeks before FOMC)
events.whyItMatters: Provides qualitative insights into regional economic trends. Released 2 weeks before FOMC meetings.

events.title: Existing Home Sales
events.description: Monthly count of existing home sales from the National Association of Realtors.
events.whyItMatters: Key indicator of housing market health. Represents ~90% of all home sales.

events.title: Natural Gas Storage
events.description: Weekly change in the number of cubic feet of natural gas held in underground storage.
events.whyItMatters: Storage levels relative to seasonal norms affect natural gas prices significantly.

events.title: CPI m/m
events.description: Consumer Price Index measures the monthly change in prices paid by consumers for goods and services.
events.whyItMatters: Primary inflation gauge that central banks target. Higher inflation typically leads to rate hikes, lower inflation to rate cuts.

typicalReaction.higherThanExpected: Currency bullish (rate hike expectations), bonds bearish, gold mixed
typicalReaction.lowerThanExpected: Currency bearish (rate cut expectations), bonds bullish

events.title: UoM Consumer Sentiment
events.description: University of Michigan survey measuring consumer attitudes about the economy and personal finances.
events.whyItMatters: Consumer confidence affects spending. Includes closely-watched inflation expectations.
events.frequency: Monthly (preliminary mid-month, final end of month)

events.title: S&P/Case-Shiller Home Price Index
events.description: Monthly measure of residential home prices in 20 major US metropolitan areas.
events.whyItMatters: Key indicator of housing market health and household wealth.

events.title: CB Consumer Confidence
events.description: Monthly survey measuring consumer attitudes about current and future economic conditions.
events.whyItMatters: Leading indicator of consumer spending. Higher confidence = more likely to spend.

events.title: Richmond Fed Manufacturing Index
events.description: Monthly survey of manufacturing conditions in the Fifth Federal Reserve District.
events.whyItMatters: Regional indicator that can signal broader manufacturing trends.

events.whyItMatters: Inventory builds suggest weak demand or oversupply, pushing oil prices lower. Draws indicate strong demand, pushing prices higher.

events.title: FOMC Rate Decision
events.description: Federal Reserve's decision on the federal funds target rate.

typicalReaction.hawkish: USD bullish, stocks bearish, bonds bearish
typicalReaction.dovish: USD bearish, stocks bullish, bonds bullish

events.whyItMatters: The most important monetary policy decision globally. Rate changes affect borrowing costs, currency values, and asset prices worldwide.

events.title: Fed Chair Press Conference
events.description: Fed Chair's press conference following the rate decision, providing context and forward guidance.

typicalReaction.hawkish: USD bullish, stocks bearish
typicalReaction.dovish: USD bearish, stocks bullish

events.whyItMatters: May affect market sentiment and currency values.

events.title: Pending Home Sales m/m
events.description: Monthly index of home sales contracts signed but not yet closed.
events.whyItMatters: Leading indicator for existing home sales (typically close 1-2 months later).

events.title: Natural Gas Storage
events.description: Weekly change in the number of cubic feet of natural gas held in underground storage.
events.whyItMatters: Storage levels relative to seasonal norms affect natural gas prices significantly.

events.title: Chicago PMI
events.description: Monthly survey of Chicago-area purchasing managers measuring business conditions.
events.whyItMatters: Released before national ISM PMI, can preview broader manufacturing trends.

events.title: ISM Manufacturing PMI
events.description: Institute for Supply Management survey of purchasing managers at 400+ manufacturing firms. Above 50 = expansion.
events.whyItMatters: Most watched US manufacturing indicator. Strong predictor of industrial production and GDP.

events.title: ISM Manufacturing Prices
events.description: Input prices paid by manufacturers. Leading indicator of producer and consumer inflation.
events.whyItMatters: Rising prices signal inflation pressures building in supply chain.

events.title: ISM Manufacturing Employment
events.description: Employment component of ISM Manufacturing survey.
events.whyItMatters: Provides early read on manufacturing employment ahead of NFP.

events.title: ISM Manufacturing New Orders
events.description: New orders component - most forward-looking part of ISM survey.
events.whyItMatters: New orders lead production by 1-2 months. Strong predictor of future activity.

events.whyItMatters: Inventory builds suggest weak demand or oversupply, pushing oil prices lower. Draws indicate strong demand, pushing prices higher.

events.title: ISM Services PMI

events.whyItMatters: Services dominate the US economy. This is increasingly more important than manufacturing PMI.

events.whyItMatters: Services employ most Americans. Key input for NFP expectations.

events.whyItMatters: Storage levels relative to seasonal norms affect natural gas prices significantly.

events.title: FOMC Meeting Minutes
events.description: Detailed record of the FOMC policy meeting, released 3 weeks after each meeting.

typicalReaction.hawkish: USD bullish, stocks bearish, bonds bearish
typicalReaction.dovish: USD bearish, stocks bullish, bonds bullish

events.frequency: 8 times per year (3 weeks after FOMC)
events.whyItMatters: May affect market sentiment and currency values.

events.title: Non-Farm Payrolls
events.description: Measures the change in the number of employed people in the US, excluding farm workers, government employees, private household employees, and nonprofit organization employees.
events.whyItMatters: The most important employment indicator. Strong job growth signals economic expansion and can lead to Fed rate hikes. Weak numbers suggest economic slowdown and potential rate cuts.

typicalReaction.higherThanExpected: USD bullish, stocks mixed (good economy but higher rates), bonds bearish
typicalReaction.lowerThanExpected: USD bearish, stocks mixed (weak economy but lower rates), bonds bullish

events.whyItMatters: Inventory builds suggest weak demand or oversupply, pushing oil prices lower. Draws indicate strong demand, pushing prices higher.

events.title: 5-Year Note Auction
events.description: US Treasury auction for 5-year government notes.
events.whyItMatters: Middle of the curve. Key benchmark for corporate bonds.

events.title: GDP q/q
events.description: Quarterly change in Gross Domestic Product - the broadest measure of economic activity.
events.whyItMatters: Shows overall economic health. Two consecutive negative quarters typically defines recession.

events.title: Core PCE Price Index m/m
events.description: Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index excluding food and energy. Fed's preferred inflation measure.
events.whyItMatters: THE inflation measure the Fed targets. More important than CPI for Fed policy.

typicalReaction.higherThanExpected: USD bullish, bonds bearish, stocks mixed
typicalReaction.lowerThanExpected: USD bearish, bonds bullish, stocks mixed

events.title: Durable Goods Orders m/m
events.description: New orders for long-lasting manufactured goods (3+ year lifespan).
events.whyItMatters: Shows business investment intentions. Very volatile due to aircraft orders.

events.title: Unemployment Claims
events.description: Weekly count of individuals filing for unemployment insurance for the first time. Also called Initial Jobless Claims.
events.whyItMatters: High-frequency indicator of labor market conditions. Rising claims can be an early warning of economic weakness.

events.title: Pending Home Sales m/m
events.description: Monthly index of home sales contracts signed but not yet closed.
events.whyItMatters: Leading indicator for existing home sales (typically close 1-2 months later).

events.title: Natural Gas Storage
events.description: Weekly change in the number of cubic feet of natural gas held in underground storage.
events.whyItMatters: Storage levels relative to seasonal norms affect natural gas prices significantly.

events.title: 7-Year Note Auction
events.description: US Treasury auction for 7-year government notes.
events.whyItMatters: Part of the belly of the curve.

events.title: Chicago PMI
events.description: Monthly survey of Chicago-area purchasing managers measuring business conditions.
events.whyItMatters: Released before national ISM PMI, can preview broader manufacturing trends.

events.title: ISM Manufacturing PMI
events.description: Institute for Supply Management survey of purchasing managers at 400+ manufacturing firms. Above 50 = expansion.
events.whyItMatters: Most watched US manufacturing indicator. Strong predictor of industrial production and GDP.

events.title: ISM Manufacturing Prices
events.description: Input prices paid by manufacturers. Leading indicator of producer and consumer inflation.
events.whyItMatters: Rising prices signal inflation pressures building in supply chain.

events.title: ISM Manufacturing Employment
events.description: Employment component of ISM Manufacturing survey.
events.whyItMatters: Provides early read on manufacturing employment ahead of NFP.

events.title: ISM Manufacturing New Orders
events.description: New orders component - most forward-looking part of ISM survey.
events.whyItMatters: New orders lead production by 1-2 months. Strong predictor of future activity.

events.title: 4-Week Bill Auction
events.description: US Treasury auction for 4-week bills.
events.whyItMatters: Short-term funding rate. Reflects money market conditions.

events.title: 8-Week Bill Auction
events.description: US Treasury auction for 8-week bills.
events.whyItMatters: Short-term funding rate.

events.title: API Weekly Crude Stock
events.description: American Petroleum Institute weekly crude oil inventory estimate. Released Tuesday evening as a preview of official EIA data.
events.whyItMatters: Early indicator of official EIA data. Large deviations from expectations can move oil prices in after-hours trading.

events.title: Crude Oil Inventories
events.description: Weekly change in the number of barrels of crude oil held in inventory by commercial firms.
events.whyItMatters: Inventory builds suggest weak demand or oversupply, pushing oil prices lower. Draws indicate strong demand, pushing prices higher.

events.title: Fed Beige Book
events.description: Summary of economic conditions across the 12 Federal Reserve districts based on anecdotal reports.

typicalReaction.hawkish: USD mildly bullish
typicalReaction.dovish: USD mildly bearish

events.frequency: 8 times per year (2 weeks before FOMC)
events.whyItMatters: Provides qualitative insights into regional economic trends. Released 2 weeks before FOMC meetings.

events.title: ISM Services PMI
events.description: ISM survey of service sector purchasing managers. Services represent ~80% of US economy.
events.whyItMatters: Services dominate the US economy. This is increasingly more important than manufacturing PMI.

events.title: ISM Services Prices
events.description: Prices paid component of ISM Services survey.
events.whyItMatters: Services inflation is stickier than goods. Key Fed watch item.

events.title: ISM Services Employment
events.description: Employment component of ISM Services survey.
events.whyItMatters: Services employ most Americans. Key input for NFP expectations.

events.title: Durable Goods Orders m/m
events.description: New orders for long-lasting manufactured goods (3+ year lifespan).
events.whyItMatters: Shows business investment intentions. Very volatile due to aircraft orders.

events.title: Trade Balance
events.description: Difference between exports and imports of goods and services.
events.whyItMatters: Large deficits can weaken currency. Trade data affects GDP calculations.

events.title: Nonfarm Productivity q/q
events.description: Quarterly change in labor efficiency - output per hour worked in the non-farm business sector.
events.whyItMatters: Higher productivity allows wages to rise without fueling inflation. Key for Fed policy.

events.title: Unemployment Claims
events.description: Weekly count of individuals filing for unemployment insurance for the first time. Also called Initial Jobless Claims.
events.whyItMatters: High-frequency indicator of labor market conditions. Rising claims can be an early warning of economic weakness.

events.title: Natural Gas Storage
events.description: Weekly change in the number of cubic feet of natural gas held in underground storage.
events.whyItMatters: Storage levels relative to seasonal norms affect natural gas prices significantly.

events.title: Non-Farm Payrolls
events.description: Measures the change in the number of employed people in the US, excluding farm workers, government employees, private household employees, and nonprofit organization employees.
events.whyItMatters: The most important employment indicator. Strong job growth signals economic expansion and can lead to Fed rate hikes. Weak numbers suggest economic slowdown and potential rate cuts.

typicalReaction.higherThanExpected: USD bullish, stocks mixed (good economy but higher rates), bonds bearish
typicalReaction.lowerThanExpected: USD bearish, stocks mixed (weak economy but lower rates), bonds bullish

events.title: Consumer Credit m/m
events.description: Monthly change in total outstanding credit extended to individuals, excluding mortgages.
events.whyItMatters: Shows consumer borrowing behavior. Rising credit can indicate confidence but also debt risks.

events.title: 4-Week Bill Auction
events.description: US Treasury auction for 4-week bills.
events.whyItMatters: Short-term funding rate. Reflects money market conditions.

events.title: 8-Week Bill Auction
events.description: US Treasury auction for 8-week bills.
events.whyItMatters: Short-term funding rate.

events.title: API Weekly Crude Stock
events.description: American Petroleum Institute weekly crude oil inventory estimate. Released Tuesday evening as a preview of official EIA data.
events.whyItMatters: Early indicator of official EIA data. Large deviations from expectations can move oil prices in after-hours trading.

events.title: CPI m/m
events.description: Consumer Price Index measures the monthly change in prices paid by consumers for goods and services.
events.whyItMatters: Primary inflation gauge that central banks target. Higher inflation typically leads to rate hikes, lower inflation to rate cuts.

typicalReaction.higherThanExpected: Currency bullish (rate hike expectations), bonds bearish, gold mixed
typicalReaction.lowerThanExpected: Currency bearish (rate cut expectations), bonds bullish

events.title: Crude Oil Inventories
events.description: Weekly change in the number of barrels of crude oil held in inventory by commercial firms.
events.whyItMatters: Inventory builds suggest weak demand or oversupply, pushing oil prices lower. Draws indicate strong demand, pushing prices higher.

events.title: EIA Short-Term Energy Outlook
events.description: Monthly report with forecasts for oil, natural gas, and electricity prices and supply/demand.
events.whyItMatters: Provides official government outlook on energy markets. Can shift price expectations.

events.title: 10-Year Note Auction
events.description: US Treasury auction for 10-year government notes.
events.whyItMatters: 10-year yield is benchmark for mortgages and corporate bonds. Weak auctions can spike yields.

typicalReaction.higherThanExpected: Strong demand = yields fall, USD mildly bullish
typicalReaction.lowerThanExpected: Weak demand = yields rise, USD mildly bearish

events.title: Federal Budget Balance
events.description: Monthly US government budget surplus or deficit.
events.whyItMatters: Large deficits can affect Treasury supply and long-term rates.

events.title: FOMC Rate Decision
events.description: Federal Reserve's decision on the federal funds target rate.

typicalReaction.hawkish: USD bullish, stocks bearish, bonds bearish
typicalReaction.dovish: USD bearish, stocks bullish, bonds bullish

events.whyItMatters: The most important monetary policy decision globally. Rate changes affect borrowing costs, currency values, and asset prices worldwide.

events.title: FOMC Economic Projections
events.description: Summary of Economic Projections (SEP) including the "dot plot" showing Fed officials' rate forecasts.

typicalReaction.hawkish: USD bullish, stocks bearish (higher rate path)
typicalReaction.dovish: USD bearish, stocks bullish (lower rate path)

events.whyItMatters: May affect market sentiment and currency values.

events.whyItMatters: Part of the belly of the curve.

events.description: Monthly index of home sales contracts signed but not yet closed.

events.title: FOMC Rate Decision
events.description: Federal Reserve's decision on the federal funds target rate.

typicalReaction.hawkish: USD bullish, stocks bearish, bonds bearish
typicalReaction.dovish: USD bearish, stocks bullish, bonds bullish

events.whyItMatters: The most important monetary policy decision globally. Rate changes affect borrowing costs, currency values, and asset prices worldwide.

events.title: Fed Chair Press Conference
events.description: Fed Chair's press conference following the rate decision, providing context and forward guidance.

typicalReaction.hawkish: USD bullish, stocks bearish
typicalReaction.dovish: USD bearish, stocks bullish

events.whyItMatters: May affect market sentiment and currency values.

events.title: GDP q/q
events.description: Quarterly change in Gross Domestic Product - the broadest measure of economic activity.
events.whyItMatters: Shows overall economic health. Two consecutive negative quarters typically defines recession.

events.title: Core PCE Price Index m/m
events.description: Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index excluding food and energy. Fed's preferred inflation measure.
events.whyItMatters: THE inflation measure the Fed targets. More important than CPI for Fed policy.

typicalReaction.higherThanExpected: USD bullish, bonds bearish, stocks mixed
typicalReaction.lowerThanExpected: USD bearish, bonds bullish, stocks mixed

events.title: Employment Cost Index q/q
events.description: Quarterly change in total compensation costs (wages + benefits) for civilian workers.
events.whyItMatters: Broadest measure of labor costs. Fed's preferred wage inflation gauge.

events.title: Unemployment Claims
events.description: Weekly count of individuals filing for unemployment insurance for the first time. Also called Initial Jobless Claims.
events.whyItMatters: High-frequency indicator of labor market conditions. Rising claims can be an early warning of economic weakness.

events.title: Chicago PMI
events.description: Monthly survey of Chicago-area purchasing managers measuring business conditions.
events.whyItMatters: Released before national ISM PMI, can preview broader manufacturing trends.

events.title: Natural Gas Storage
events.description: Weekly change in the number of cubic feet of natural gas held in underground storage.
events.whyItMatters: Storage levels relative to seasonal norms affect natural gas prices significantly.

events.title: ISM Manufacturing PMI
events.description: Institute for Supply Management survey of purchasing managers at 400+ manufacturing firms. Above 50 = expansion.
events.whyItMatters: Most watched US manufacturing indicator. Strong predictor of industrial production and GDP.

events.title: ISM Manufacturing Prices
events.description: Input prices paid by manufacturers. Leading indicator of producer and consumer inflation.
events.whyItMatters: Rising prices signal inflation pressures building in supply chain.

events.title: ISM Manufacturing Employment
events.description: Employment component of ISM Manufacturing survey.
events.whyItMatters: Provides early read on manufacturing employment ahead of NFP.

events.title: ISM Manufacturing New Orders
events.description: New orders component - most forward-looking part of ISM survey.
events.whyItMatters: New orders lead production by 1-2 months. Strong predictor of future activity.

events.title: Durable Goods Orders m/m
events.description: New orders for long-lasting manufactured goods (3+ year lifespan).
events.whyItMatters: Shows business investment intentions. Very volatile due to aircraft orders.

events.title: 4-Week Bill Auction
events.description: US Treasury auction for 4-week bills.
events.whyItMatters: Short-term funding rate. Reflects money market conditions.

events.title: 8-Week Bill Auction
events.description: US Treasury auction for 8-week bills.
events.whyItMatters: Short-term funding rate.

events.title: Trade Balance
events.description: Difference between exports and imports of goods and services.
events.whyItMatters: Large deficits can weaken currency. Trade data affects GDP calculations.

events.title: ISM Services PMI
events.description: ISM survey of service sector purchasing managers. Services represent ~80% of US economy.
events.whyItMatters: Services dominate the US economy. This is increasingly more important than manufacturing PMI.

events.title: ISM Services Prices
events.description: Prices paid component of ISM Services survey.
events.whyItMatters: Services inflation is stickier than goods. Key Fed watch item.

events.title: ISM Services Employment
events.description: Employment component of ISM Services survey.
events.whyItMatters: Services employ most Americans. Key input for NFP expectations.

events.title: API Weekly Crude Stock
events.description: American Petroleum Institute weekly crude oil inventory estimate. Released Tuesday evening as a preview of official EIA data.
events.whyItMatters: Early indicator of official EIA data. Large deviations from expectations can move oil prices in after-hours trading.

events.title: Crude Oil Inventories
events.description: Weekly change in the number of barrels of crude oil held in inventory by commercial firms.
events.whyItMatters: Inventory builds suggest weak demand or oversupply, pushing oil prices lower. Draws indicate strong demand, pushing prices higher.

events.title: EIA Short-Term Energy Outlook
events.description: Monthly report with forecasts for oil, natural gas, and electricity prices and supply/demand.
events.whyItMatters: Provides official government outlook on energy markets. Can shift price expectations.

events.title: Nonfarm Productivity q/q
events.description: Quarterly change in labor efficiency - output per hour worked in the non-farm business sector.
events.whyItMatters: Higher productivity allows wages to rise without fueling inflation. Key for Fed policy.

events.title: Unemployment Claims
events.description: Weekly count of individuals filing for unemployment insurance for the first time. Also called Initial Jobless Claims.
events.whyItMatters: High-frequency indicator of labor market conditions. Rising claims can be an early warning of economic weakness.

events.title: Natural Gas Storage
events.description: Weekly change in the number of cubic feet of natural gas held in underground storage.
events.whyItMatters: Storage levels relative to seasonal norms affect natural gas prices significantly.

events.title: Consumer Credit m/m
events.description: Monthly change in total outstanding credit extended to individuals, excluding mortgages.
events.whyItMatters: Shows consumer borrowing behavior. Rising credit can indicate confidence but also debt risks.

events.title: Non-Farm Payrolls
events.description: Measures the change in the number of employed people in the US, excluding farm workers, government employees, private household employees, and nonprofit organization employees.
events.whyItMatters: The most important employment indicator. Strong job growth signals economic expansion and can lead to Fed rate hikes. Weak numbers suggest economic slowdown and potential rate cuts.

typicalReaction.higherThanExpected: USD bullish, stocks mixed (good economy but higher rates), bonds bearish
typicalReaction.lowerThanExpected: USD bearish, stocks mixed (weak economy but lower rates), bonds bullish

events.title: 10-Year Note Auction
events.description: US Treasury auction for 10-year government notes.
events.whyItMatters: 10-year yield is benchmark for mortgages and corporate bonds. Weak auctions can spike yields.

typicalReaction.higherThanExpected: Strong demand = yields fall, USD mildly bullish
typicalReaction.lowerThanExpected: Weak demand = yields rise, USD mildly bearish
